intro: Ludwigia leptocarpa subsp. angustissima, commonly known as narrowleaf water primrose, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in slow-moving freshwater habitats such as ponds and marshes. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in water gardens and aquariums.
